result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ramon L Novoa

records.addlTxt: State's Initial Discovery Cover LetterState's Initial Discovery Cover Letter

1:46 PM Defendant appears in person in custody. Attorney Breanna Halyburton appears in person. State of Wisconsin appears by Alex Seifert in person. Deputy Tom Mantsch sworn in and testifies 1:47. Alex Seifert leads testimony. Defendant is identified in court. Attny Halyburton- cross examines 1:51 Witness released 1:53. Ct- based upon testimony probable cause felony was committed in Forest County. Attny Halyburton- waiving document and enter not guilty plea. Bond set to $500 cash. Set for Trial. Attny Halyburton- ask to reduce bond. Unable to post cash bail. Asks for signature bond. Upon release he is to report to green bay probation to get GPS monitoring. ADA Seifert- up to courts discretion. Ct-Modify bond to $3,000 signature. Defendant- lives at 510 James Street. Due to construction now in Hotel Shawano avenue motel 6 in green bay. Attny Halyburton-There is a lease signed for apartment in GB but landlord in process of completing repairs. Does receive mail but currently staying at hotel until work is completed at the apartment. Defendant- should be done by the end of this month and able to move back into apartment. Mail to PO Matthew Dolley 200 North Jefferson. 773-715-8923. Adj 2:00

10:08 AM Defendant Ramon L Novoa appeared by video, in custody from FOSO.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Ramon L Novoa.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for State of Wisconsin. Halyburton and Novoa have complaint, waives reading of it, requests PH but wants to be heard on bond prior to making decision to waive time limits. Court allows. Halyburton - bond - asks for reduction in bond (high signature bond) for stated reasons. State - bond - asks for at least $500.00 cash bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - will reduce bond for $500.00 cash, sets for PH within time limits on 9/28/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
9:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Halyburton appears in person.Defendant Roman L Novoa appeared by video, in custody from FC jail. Attorney Halyburton explains case was just filed and has not opted in yet, has not went over the complaint and is asking for AIA. Court reads charges and penalties. Novoa understands. Attorney Halyburton is asking for reduction of bond, on probation hold, supervised in Brown County, asks for high signature bond for reasons as indicated on the record. State objects to reduction of bond, asks for bond to continue. Court - continues bond at this point and will have set for AIA.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
